00016 /*
00017  * rawobj stuff
00018  */
00019 typedef struct netobj_s {
00020         __u32           len;
00021         __u8            data[0];
00022 } netobj_t;
00023 
00024 #define NETOBJ_EMPTY    ((netobj_t) { 0 })
00025 
00026 typedef struct rawobj_s {
00027         __u32           len;
00028         __u8           *data;
00029 } rawobj_t;
00030 
00031 #define RAWOBJ_EMPTY    ((rawobj_t) { 0, NULL })
00032 
00033 typedef struct rawobj_buf_s {
00034         __u32           dataoff;
00035         __u32           datalen;
00036         __u32           buflen;
00037         __u8           *buf;
00038 } rawobj_buf_t;
00039 
00040 int rawobj_empty(rawobj_t *obj);
00041 int rawobj_alloc(rawobj_t *obj, char *buf, int len);
00042 void rawobj_free(rawobj_t *obj);
00043 int rawobj_equal(rawobj_t *a, rawobj_t *b);
00044 int rawobj_dup(rawobj_t *dest, rawobj_t *src);
00045 int rawobj_serialize(rawobj_t *obj, __u32 **buf, __u32 *buflen);
00046 int rawobj_extract(rawobj_t *obj, __u32 **buf, __u32 *buflen);
00047 int rawobj_extract_alloc(rawobj_t *obj, __u32 **buf, __u32 *buflen);
00048 int rawobj_extract_local(rawobj_t *obj, __u32 **buf, __u32 *buflen);
00049 int rawobj_extract_local_alloc(rawobj_t *obj, __u32 **buf, __u32 *buflen);
00050 int rawobj_from_netobj(rawobj_t *rawobj, netobj_t *netobj);
00051 int rawobj_from_netobj_alloc(rawobj_t *obj, netobj_t *netobj);

00054                          void *res, __u32 reslen);
00055 
00056 /*
00057  * several timeout values. client refresh upcall timeout we using
00058  * default in pipefs implemnetation.
00059  */
00060 #define __TIMEOUT_DELTA                 (10)
00061 
00062 #define GSS_SECINIT_RPC_TIMEOUT                                         \
00063         (obd_timeout < __TIMEOUT_DELTA ?                                \
00064          __TIMEOUT_DELTA : obd_timeout - __TIMEOUT_DELTA)
00065 
00066 #define GSS_SECFINI_RPC_TIMEOUT         (__TIMEOUT_DELTA)
00067 #define GSS_SECSVC_UPCALL_TIMEOUT       (GSS_SECINIT_RPC_TIMEOUT)
00068 
00069 /*
00070  * default gc interval
00071  */
00072 #define GSS_GC_INTERVAL                 (60 * 60) /* 60 minutes */
00073 
00074 static inline
00075 unsigned long gss_round_ctx_expiry(unsigned long expiry,
00076                                    unsigned long sec_flags)
00077 {
00078         if (sec_flags & PTLRPC_SEC_FL_REVERSE)
00079                 return expiry;
00080 
00081         if (get_seconds() + __TIMEOUT_DELTA <= expiry)
00082                 return expiry - __TIMEOUT_DELTA;
00083 
00084         return expiry;
00085 }
00086 
00087 /*
00088  * Max encryption element in block cipher algorithms.
00089  */
00090 #define GSS_MAX_CIPHER_BLOCK               (16)
00091 
00092 /*
00093  * XXX make it visible of kernel and lgssd/lsvcgssd
00094  */
00095 #define GSSD_INTERFACE_VERSION          (1)
00096 
00097 #define PTLRPC_GSS_VERSION              (1)
00098

00100 enum ptlrpc_gss_proc {
00101         PTLRPC_GSS_PROC_DATA            = 0,
00102         PTLRPC_GSS_PROC_INIT            = 1,
00103         PTLRPC_GSS_PROC_CONTINUE_INIT   = 2,
00104         PTLRPC_GSS_PROC_DESTROY         = 3,
00105         PTLRPC_GSS_PROC_ERR             = 4,
00106 };
00107 
00108 enum ptlrpc_gss_tgt {
00109         LUSTRE_GSS_TGT_MGS              = 0,
00110         LUSTRE_GSS_TGT_MDS              = 1,
00111         LUSTRE_GSS_TGT_OSS              = 2,
00112 };
00113 
00114 enum ptlrpc_gss_header_flags {
00115         LUSTRE_GSS_PACK_BULK            = 1,
00116         LUSTRE_GSS_PACK_USER            = 2,
00117 };
00118 
00119 static inline
00120 __u32 import_to_gss_svc(struct obd_import *imp)
00121 {
00122         const char *name = imp->imp_obd->obd_type->typ_name;
00123 
00124         if (!strcmp(name, LUSTRE_MGC_NAME))
00125                 return LUSTRE_GSS_TGT_MGS;
00126         if (!strcmp(name, LUSTRE_MDC_NAME) ||
00127             !strcmp(name, LUSTRE_LWP_NAME))
00128                 return LUSTRE_GSS_TGT_MDS;
00129         if (!strcmp(name, LUSTRE_OSC_NAME) ||
00130             !strcmp(name, LUSTRE_OSP_NAME))
00131                 return LUSTRE_GSS_TGT_OSS;
00132 
00133         return 0;
00134 }
00135 
00136 /*
00137  * following 3 header must have the same size and offset
00138  */
00139 struct gss_header {
00140         __u8                    gh_version;     /* gss version */
00141         __u8                    gh_sp;          /* sec part */
00142         __u16                   gh_pad0;
00143         __u32                   gh_flags;       /* wrap flags */
00144         __u32                   gh_proc;        /* proc */
00145         __u32                   gh_seq;         /* sequence */
00146         __u32                   gh_svc;         /* service */
00147         __u32                   gh_pad1;
00148         __u32                   gh_pad2;
00149         __u32                   gh_pad3;
00150         netobj_t                gh_handle;      /* context handle */
00151 };
00152 
00153 struct gss_rep_header {
00154         __u8                    gh_version;
00155         __u8                    gh_sp;
00156         __u16                   gh_pad0;
00157         __u32                   gh_flags;
00158         __u32                   gh_proc;
00159         __u32                   gh_major;
00160         __u32                   gh_minor;
00161         __u32                   gh_seqwin;
00162         __u32                   gh_pad2;
00163         __u32                   gh_pad3;
00164         netobj_t                gh_handle;
00165 };
00166 
00167 struct gss_err_header {
00168         __u8                    gh_version;
00169         __u8                    gh_sp;
00170         __u16                   gh_pad0;
00171         __u32                   gh_flags;
00172         __u32                   gh_proc;
00173         __u32                   gh_major;
00174         __u32                   gh_minor;
00175         __u32                   gh_pad1;
00176         __u32                   gh_pad2;
00177         __u32                   gh_pad3;
00178         netobj_t                gh_handle;
00179 };
00180 
00181 /*
00182  * part of wire context information send from client which be saved and
00183  * used later by server.
00184  */
00185 struct gss_wire_ctx {
00186         __u32                   gw_flags;
00187         __u32                   gw_proc;
00188         __u32                   gw_seq;
00189         __u32                   gw_svc;
00190         rawobj_t                gw_handle;
00191 };
00192 
00193 #define PTLRPC_GSS_MAX_HANDLE_SIZE      (8)
00194 #define PTLRPC_GSS_HEADER_SIZE          (sizeof(struct gss_header) + \
00195                                          PTLRPC_GSS_MAX_HANDLE_SIZE)
00196 
00197 
00198 static inline __u64 gss_handle_to_u64(rawobj_t *handle)
00199 {
00200         if (handle->len != PTLRPC_GSS_MAX_HANDLE_SIZE)
00201                 return -1;
00202         return *((__u64 *) handle->data);
00203 }
00204 
00205 #define GSS_SEQ_WIN                     (2048)
00206 #define GSS_SEQ_WIN_MAIN                GSS_SEQ_WIN
00207 #define GSS_SEQ_WIN_BACK                (128)
00208 #define GSS_SEQ_REPACK_THRESHOLD        (GSS_SEQ_WIN_MAIN / 2 + \
00209                                          GSS_SEQ_WIN_MAIN / 4)
00210 
00211 struct gss_svc_seq_data {
00212         spinlock_t              ssd_lock;
00213         /*
00214          * highest sequence number seen so far, for main and back window
00215          */
00216         __u32                   ssd_max_main;
00217         __u32                   ssd_max_back;
00218         /*
00219          * main and back window
00220          * for i such that ssd_max - GSS_SEQ_WIN < i <= ssd_max, the i-th bit
00221          * of ssd_win is nonzero iff sequence number i has been seen already.
00222          */
00223         unsigned long           ssd_win_main[GSS_SEQ_WIN_MAIN/BITS_PER_LONG];
00224         unsigned long           ssd_win_back[GSS_SEQ_WIN_BACK/BITS_PER_LONG];
00225 };
00226 
00227 struct gss_svc_ctx {
00228         struct gss_ctx         *gsc_mechctx;
00229         struct gss_svc_seq_data gsc_seqdata;
00230         rawobj_t                gsc_rvs_hdl;
00231         __u32                   gsc_rvs_seq;
00232         uid_t                   gsc_uid;
00233         gid_t                   gsc_gid;
00234         uid_t                   gsc_mapped_uid;
00235         unsigned int            gsc_usr_root:1,
00236                                 gsc_usr_mds:1,
00237                                 gsc_usr_oss:1,
00238                                 gsc_remote:1,
00239                                 gsc_reverse:1;
00240 };
00241 
00242 struct gss_svc_reqctx {
00243         struct ptlrpc_svc_ctx           src_base;
00244         /*
00245          * context
00246          */
00247         struct gss_wire_ctx             src_wirectx;
00248         struct gss_svc_ctx             *src_ctx;
00249         /*
00250          * record place of bulk_sec_desc in request/reply buffer
00251          */
00252         struct ptlrpc_bulk_sec_desc    *src_reqbsd;
00253         int                             src_reqbsd_size;
00254         struct ptlrpc_bulk_sec_desc    *src_repbsd;
00255         int                             src_repbsd_size;
00256         /*
00257          * flags
00258          */
00259         unsigned int                    src_init:1,
00260                                         src_init_continue:1,
00261                                         src_err_notify:1;
00262         int                             src_reserve_len;
00263 };
00264 
00265 struct gss_cli_ctx {
00266         struct ptlrpc_cli_ctx   gc_base;
00267         __u32                   gc_flavor;
00268         __u32                   gc_proc;
00269         __u32                   gc_win;
00270         atomic_t                gc_seq;
00271         rawobj_t                gc_handle;
00272         struct gss_ctx          *gc_mechctx;
00273         /* handle for the buddy svc ctx */
00274         rawobj_t                gc_svc_handle;
00275 };

00277 struct gss_cli_ctx_keyring {
00278         struct gss_cli_ctx      gck_base;
00279         struct key             *gck_key;
00280         struct timer_list      *gck_timer;
00281 };

00283 struct gss_sec {
00284         struct ptlrpc_sec       gs_base;
00285         struct gss_api_mech     *gs_mech;
00286         spinlock_t              gs_lock;
00287         __u64                   gs_rvs_hdl;
00288 };

00290 struct gss_sec_pipefs {
00291         struct gss_sec          gsp_base;
00292         int                     gsp_chash_size; /* must be 2^n */
00293         struct hlist_head       gsp_chash[0];
00294 };
00295 
00296 /*
00297  * FIXME cleanup the keyring upcall mutexes
00298  */
00299 #define HAVE_KEYRING_UPCALL_SERIALIZED  1
00300 
00301 struct gss_sec_keyring {
00302         struct gss_sec          gsk_base;
00303         /*
00304          * all contexts listed here. access is protected by sec spinlock.
00305          */
00306         struct hlist_head       gsk_clist;
00307         /*
00308          * specially point to root ctx (only one at a time). access is
00309          * protected by sec spinlock.
00310          */
00311         struct ptlrpc_cli_ctx  *gsk_root_ctx;
00312         /*
00313          * specially serialize upcalls for root context.
00314          */
00315         struct mutex                    gsk_root_uc_lock;
00316 
00317 #ifdef HAVE_KEYRING_UPCALL_SERIALIZED
00318         struct mutex            gsk_uc_lock;    /* serialize upcalls */
00319 #endif
00320 };
00321 
00322 static inline struct gss_cli_ctx *ctx2gctx(struct ptlrpc_cli_ctx *ctx)
00323 {
00324         return container_of(ctx, struct gss_cli_ctx, gc_base);
00325 }
00326 
00327 static inline
00328 struct gss_cli_ctx_keyring *ctx2gctx_keyring(struct ptlrpc_cli_ctx *ctx)
00329 {
00330         return container_of(ctx2gctx(ctx),
00331                             struct gss_cli_ctx_keyring, gck_base);
00332 }
00333 
00334 static inline struct gss_sec *sec2gsec(struct ptlrpc_sec *sec)
00335 {
00336         return container_of(sec, struct gss_sec, gs_base);
00337 }
00338 
00339 static inline struct gss_sec_pipefs *sec2gsec_pipefs(struct ptlrpc_sec *sec)
00340 {
00341         return container_of(sec2gsec(sec), struct gss_sec_pipefs, gsp_base);
00342 }
00343 
00344 static inline struct gss_sec_keyring *sec2gsec_keyring(struct ptlrpc_sec *sec)
00345 {
00346         return container_of(sec2gsec(sec), struct gss_sec_keyring, gsk_base);
00347 }

00360 struct gss_svc_reqctx *gss_svc_ctx2reqctx(struct ptlrpc_svc_ctx *ctx)
00361 {
00362         LASSERT(ctx);
00363         return container_of(ctx, struct gss_svc_reqctx, src_base);
00364 }

00366 static inline
00367 struct gss_svc_ctx *gss_svc_ctx2gssctx(struct ptlrpc_svc_ctx *ctx)
00368 {
00369         LASSERT(ctx);

00521 /* debug */
00522 static inline
00523 void __dbg_memdump(char *name, void *ptr, int size)
00524 {
00525         char *buf, *p = (char *) ptr;
00526         int bufsize = size * 2 + 1, i;
00527 
00528         OBD_ALLOC(buf, bufsize);
00529         if (!buf) {
00530                 CDEBUG(D_ERROR, "DUMP ERROR: can't alloc %d bytes\n", bufsize);
00531                 return;
00532         }
00533 
00534         for (i = 0; i < size; i++)
00535                 sprintf(&buf[i+i], "%02x", (__u8) p[i]);
00536         buf[size + size] = '\0';
00537         LCONSOLE_INFO("DUMP %s@%p(%d): %s\n", name, ptr, size, buf);
00538         OBD_FREE(buf, bufsize);
00539 }
